title: Has Anyone Received Confirmation for Reporting a Troll/Intent Feeder?
body:
As the title says, has anyone received one of those confirmation messages advising that person was banned for trolling/intent feeding? I seem to get the message when I report those verbally abusing others, but in my entire League gaming I have never received confirmation after reporting an intent feeder.

Has anyone else?

replies.body: Pretty sure their automated system for banning intent feeders doesn't work at all.

1 bad game in 30 isnt good enough reason to ban if they were just being a bit of a dick. It needs to be constant all bans picked up by automated have the chatlogs sent to a rioter to look over, if it is really bad or multiple instances in a short period they will ban based on the severity, but if its just a one off bad mood they will over look it.

yeah and 30 games in 30 and the system still won't pick it up.

Feed bots are a thing, and they can easily last 100's of games in ranked.

Then if you have botting problems specifically state bot in the report and a rioter will be notified of it and they can instantly be rooted, the problem is people dont bother reporting the bots, and when they do they dont mention its a bot so the system skips that as there being no reason for the report and your report severity decreases.

Hint: If a person is feeding 100's of games in a row, and a report does nothing, it's not the reporting player's fault, it's the system's fault for being a piece of shit.

And as an aside i always put a reason in (bot, Scripting, boosted etc.)

You never know, they could literally be just that bad.

Calling the system a piece of shit is literally calling every single rioter a piece of shit, as the bans are passed through a rioter check first where the person looks at it and deems whether or not they should be punished.
god damn i hate the ignorance that some people have towards the ban system.

Jason...

Ever heard that one about the pot and the kettle?

I have, have you ever heard of never taking everything you are told as law and order?

Never heard of the accounts that have managed to feed 200+ games and get into bronze 5 before they are even detected?

Because they have occured, and it's not an anomaly.

Im not saying none are bots, I'm saying that some or them are potentially that bad,, what you think thee seven yearolds and the like are all diamond and plat? Riot needs time to determine if its a bot or they simply lack all sorts of skill.

No they don't NEED time, if they actually got off their asses and made moves to detect scripts and bots.

But they don't.

That isn't a defense, it's fucking laziness.

you're absolutely right. You are a fucking bot, riot please perma ban JasonWazza.

How that feel? Being banned just because you are bad, you of all people should be able to relate.

Why are you so mad about this? What do you want Riot to do? Do you have an idea on how to fix this?
Or do you just want to be mad about something?

Most people don't report, that's the only flaw on Riots side, they feel like reporting doesn't do anything and just don't think to do it.

So long as you're reporting bots and adding the word "bot" into the report description, they will be removed eventually, as Riot ban in waves.


Before you try to come back with something rude and offensive, take a breather and remember that we are people, like yourself.

I really haven't seen the huge amount of feeder bots like everyone on OCE has been complaining about in the recent month or so (however I do mainly play on NA - don't ask). 
However, I'm also perplexed as to how these accounts can even make it to level 30 as their behaviour is blatantly obvious which leads to quite a few reports _each_ game. 

I'm sure that 4 reports from just one match is insufficient reasoning to perma-ban an account (deleting them would be way better, not sure if they do this or not), though these accounts would have this sort of situation match after match after match. 


And to actually respond to OP's question, no, I have never got a response on either NA or OCE about reports I've made which refer to bot accounts or int'ers.

> I'm sure that 4 reports from just one match is insufficient reasoning to perma-ban an account

It depends on the reason for the report. One report is (generally) enough to trigger a review of an account, and from there it depends on the offence as to whether it would be enough for a perma-ban (3rd party software offences [such as using bots] are always instant bans, though done in waves).
A few. But I report frequently and I think the strength of my reports is diminished as a result.
yeah i got a few from reporting.
Yeah i have had one of those messages on 2 seperate accounts of mine.

> [{quoted}](name=Roguestoney,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=iEcAKMzV,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-30T00:48:09.818+0000)
>
> Yeah i have had one of those messages on 2 seperate accounts of mine.

Was it purely for intent feeding/griefing or was verb abuse etc thrown in?
I remember 1 for sure was for intent feeding only. The other was too long ago to remember exactly what it was for.

Last banned person message i received was count #21.

Each of the bans was only with an accurate description of the offence for the rioter to read and confirm, and only when real right out dickheads. Also, if its for intent feeding or griefing, you need to take note of those times in game so if need be the rioter can look at the game footage and determine if it was intent or being plain bad.

Every punishment you contribute to increases the severity of your reports, while spamming them our of spite of if they really didn't deserve it, such as they just killed you a lot and you got salty, will reduce the severity of your bans, making them more prone to being overlooked.

I get one of these about every two to three weeks of heavy play. 
I think leaving a fair and accurate description of what happened is why.

I will always write a short explaination to why im reporting.
My logic is that if someone looks to be inting but isnt a troll, I wouldnt want them to be punished just like i wouldnt want to be wrongly punished.
